Package org.apache.wayang.core.mapping

Class OperatorPattern<T extends Operator>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.wayang.core.plan.wayangplan.OperatorBase
      • org.apache.wayang.core.mapping.OperatorPattern<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Operator
    public class OperatorPattern<T extends Operator>
extends OperatorBase
    An operator pattern matches to a class of operator instances.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • OperatorPattern

        public OperatorPattern​(java.lang.String name,
                       T exampleOperator,
                       boolean isMatchSubclasses)
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        name - used to identify the new instance (e.g., in SubplanMatches)
        exampleOperator - serves as template of the Operators to match; use DataSetType.none() to state that the DataSetType of a certain Slot are not to be matched
        isMatchSubclasses - whether to match subclasses of the exampleOperator

    • Method Detail

      • match

        public OperatorMatch match​(Operator operator)
        Test whether this pattern matches a given operator.
        Parameters:
        operator - the operator to match or null, which represents the absence of an operator to match
        Returns:
        whether the operator matches

      • withAdditionalTest

        public OperatorPattern<T> withAdditionalTest​(java.util.function.Predicate<T> additionalTest)
        Add an additional Predicate that must be satisfied in order to establish matches with Operators.
        Parameters:
        additionalTest - the Predicate
        Returns:
        this instance
